reactions.description: The combustion of hydrogen gas with oxygen gas produces water vapor.
The combustion of methane gas with oxygen gas produces carbon dioxide and water vapor.
The Haber-Bosch process is used to synthesize ammonia gas from nitrogen gas and hydrogen gas.
Sodium metal reacts with hydrochloric acid to produce sodium chloride and hydrogen gas.
Calcium carbonate decomposes into calcium oxide and carbon dioxide gas when heated.
